snippet: Dan and Marty Campanelli of New Jersey have spent a decade tracing the genealogies of sampler makers and identifying their stitched scenery.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; Dan and Marty Campanelli have spent a decade researching the history and genealogy of the makers of the many antique embroidery samplers they have collected at their western New Jersey farm; traveling exhibition Inventing the Modern World: Decorative Arts at the World’s Fairs, 1851-1939 will open at the Carnegie Museum of Art in Pittsburgh.
lead_paragraph: Dan and Marty Campanelli of New Jersey have spent a decade tracing the genealogies of sampler makers and identifying their stitched scenery.

headline.seo: Collectors of Girls’ Sampler Embroidery on East Coast
headline.main: By Their Samplers They Will Know Them
headline.print_headline: By Their Samplers They Will Know Them
